subject: Ethics
title: Greenwashing Exposed
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Greenwashing Exposed.

hook.text: A fast fashion brand labels a shirt 'eco-friendly' because it uses 5% recycled thread. The rest? Pure polyester.

buildup.text: Greenwashing is when companies market products as sustainable while their core practices remain destructive.

discovery.text: A 2021 EU study found that 42% of green claims online were exaggerated, deceptive, or outright false.

twist.text: Greenwashing doesn't just mislead consumers. It steals market share from genuinely sustainable companies.

climax.text: New regulations like the EU Green Claims Directive now require companies to prove environmental claims with data.

punchline.text: If everyone's 'green,' the word means nothing.

quiz.question: What is greenwashing?
options: A sustainable method of cleaning industrial equipment
Marketing products as eco-friendly while core practices remain destructive
A government program to fund green energy startups
